column1: Which of the following options will save edits made to a record?
column2: Save

column1: How would a user return to their default homepage/default workspace?
column2: By clicking on the image in the top left corner

column1: Data publications allow a user to extract data from Archer and load it to:
column2: An external database

column1: An iView or Widget can be used to display which of the following?
column2: Any of these

column1: Ruth noticed that after updating a record and closing it, the new information wasn’t in the records when she opened it again. This is because:
column2: She did not select Save

column1: What is the focus of the Third Party Management solution area in Archer?
column2: Managing supplier relationships and monitoring third-part risks

column1: A keyword search searches for a specific word or string within one or more:
column2: Applications

column1: Applications which are entirely designed and deployed by your organization for your specific business needs are called:
column2: On-Demand Applications

column1: Applications house specific sets of ___________:
column2: Records

column1: A field that cannot be edited but changes based on information entered into other fields is a:
column2: Calculated field

column1: Which of the following best describes a Solution within Archer?
column2: A grouping of applications designed to address a specific business need

column1: In Archer, which feature allows importing data from external systems?
column2: Data Feed Manager

column1: In order to determine what an organization has purchased from Archer, an administrator should check the ______________:
column2: Licensing Information

column1: Users can filter search results based on any of the following EXCEPT which of the following options?
column2: Size of Records

column1: Sonja was viewing a record in Archer. She wanted to add a note to it, but the Edit button was greyed out. What would cause this?
column2: Sonja does not have editing permissions for this record

column1: How does Archer Evolv Risk help organizations manage risk more effectively?
column2: By providing a centralized platform for monitoring and mitigating risks in real time

column1: Which is NOT a method by which data can be imported into Archer?
column2: Scanning

column1: Which of the following features is most commonly associated with Archer Evolv Compliance?
column2: Continuous monitoring of regulatory changes, document processing, obligations catalog, and controls alignment

column1: Once a user performs an advanced search against an application, the search may be saved as a(n):
column2: Report

column1: If a user wanted to provide additional information to a questionnaire item, they should:
column2: Open and submit a comment attached to the question

column1: Andre’s job as a business resiliency analyst includes logging and reporting crisis events to his Chief Risk Officer and Chief InfoSec Officer. Currently, Andre maintains this data on a spreadsheet that he updates and emails to the CRO and CISO as necessary. How might this practice be putting his organization in danger of increased risk?
column2: All of these

column1: Data Feeds are ideally used for which of the following?
column2: Data to be sent out of Archer and into an external database on a regular cadence

column1: Ayanna no longer needs to receive a specific weekly risk report Subscription Notification. In order to opt out of the emailed report, she should:
column2: Navigate to email subscriptions, locate the report in her subscriptions list, and uncheck the subscribed box

column1: What does Archer Evolv Risk use to enhance its risk management processes?
column2: AI and machine learning predict potential risks and optimize workflows

column1: Which is NOT a right that can be assigned to a user in Archer?
column2: APPEND

column1: Terri created a report and saved it, but wants to edit the filters she used to make the data more relevant for her team. Which option should she select from the report toolbar?
column2: Modify (Classic UI) or Edit Search (SaaS UI)

column1: Serena has five tasks within Archer assigned to her, and she can see all five tasks in a "My Tasks" report on her dashboard. Serena visits her teammate Beth, and peers over her shoulder to see the same dashboard on Beth's screen. Beth's dashboard displays ten tasks, not the five that Serena sees. What is the most likely cause?
column2: The report on the dashboard is using a filter on the Assigned To field, that limits the results returned to be only those for whom the user currently logged in can access

column1: If granted the appropriate administrative rights, end users can:
column2: All of these

column1: The main difference between a Personal Report and a Global Report is:
column2: Personal reports are only visible to the person who created the report, which Global reports can be set to be seen by others, as deigned by the person saving the report

column1: The Audit Management solution area in Archer focuses on which primary activity?
column2: Managing internal and external audit processes and tracking findings

column1: The Activity icon in the top bar shows:
column2: The user's 10 most recently added, edited, or viewed records

column1: Archer's Global Search allows users to search across:
column2: All data within Archer that the use has access to

column1: Which Archer Use Case allows an organization to consolidate information from multiple regulatory bodies into a single, searchable repository?
column2: Regulatory and Corporate Compliance management

column1: Reymundo wants to create a report that allows the user to group the results by a specific field. In the Visualization Display Options, he should select:
column2: Hierarchical

column1: JavaScript Transporters are a type of:
column2: Data Feed

column1: Which of the following best describes a record in Archer?
column2: An individual data entry in an application

column1: Which of the following is a key feature of Archer Evolv Risk?
column2: Integration of risk data with real-time security data

column1: A workspace is an organized display of which of the following?
column2: Dashboards

column1: In Archer's Classic UI, the History Log field can be displayed as a grid or as a simple link. How does the History log behave in the new SaaS UI?
column2: All of these behaviours are true in the SaaS UI

column1: Archer records that leverage Advanced Workflow will have an interactive feature that non-Advanced Workflow records do not have. Which of the following best describes this addition to the record?
column2: An Actions dropdown menu appears near the top of the record. Users can use this dropdown to advance the record to the next stage of the workflow

column1: Anca hasn’t seen a specific quarterly report email and wants to see whether she’s subscribed to that particular email notification. Which menu should she access to determine whether she is subscribed to that email?
column2: User Name Menu> Preferences > Email Subscription

column1: If a user selects the Email Record (Share > Email) option, this feature will:
column2: Open a new email in the user's email client with a link top the record

column1: Doug wants to create a report that can include one or more fields from a cross-referenced application. On the search page, Doug should choose:
column2: Add New Relationship

column1: Beatrice wants to remind her team when quarterly risk reports are due within 7 days. Her best course of action would be to:
column2: Create a scheduled notification based on the risk report due date

column1: What is the value of Archer Evolv Compliance?
column2: All of these answers are correct

column1: Archer offers one Use Case that is seen in nearly every Solution Area. This Use Case helps organizations document events (Findings) that need to resolved, often for compliance reasons. What is the name of this often-shared Use Case?
column2: Issues Management

column1: Saving a search as a report:
column2: All of these statements are true

column1: When an end user logs in to Archer their home view is of a(n):
column2: Dashboard

column1: Srishti and Jamie both work as audit managers at XYZ Corporation. Srishti notices that Jamie has additional reports showing in her Audit Manager dashboard, and Srishti does not have access to them. What might be the cause of this?
column2: Srishti and Jame do not have the same access rights

column1: Which of the following is not found in the Archer menu bar?
column2: Map display controls

column1: Record fields marked with red asterisks are:
column2: Required fields

column1: Nate’s primary task in Archer is to log findings as a submitter. Which Archer workspace option would allow him to quickly create a new finding without having to navigate to the application every time?
column2: Quick Links

column1: After performing a global search, the user may opt to transfer the search to:
column2: A specific application

column1: A report can be exported in which file format(s)?
column2: Any of these answers

column1: When a user creates a Scheduled Report Distribution, Archer will run the report:
column2: Automatically

column1: Chenoa opened a record and noticed a field was uneditable. This could possibly be because:
column2: All of these are possible reasons

column1: Laszlo transferred from the Risk Analysis team to the Business Resiliency team. He needs to be able to access records and Business Resiliency plans in Archer. Laszlo should:
column2: Ask his Archer administrator to assign him to the appropriate groups and access roles for his new position

column1: When creating a new record, you may encounter some fields marked as required, but there is no mechanism for you to manually enter data in these fields. What is the most likely reason for this?
column2: These fields are calculated and will be populated once the record is saved

column1: Groups of pre-configured Applications that are ready to use immediately after deployment of Archer are called:
column2: Use Cases

column1: If a user ran multiple searches to verify the existence of specific data within Archer and they realized the data they were looking for did not exist, which of the following actions should the user take to add a new record into Archer? (Assume the user has access rights to create records for this scenario.)
column2: Click the New Record icon (Classic UI) or Add New Record (Saas) to create a new record in Archer

column1: Access to the Archer platform is controlled by:
column2: User Accounts (username and password)

column1: All system users automatically belong to a built-in group named ______________
column2: Everyone

column1: If a user wished to access all of the available records in a specific application, the correct navigation path would be:
column2: Workspace > Solution > Application

column1: Steven is looking at a returned set of search results in the Classic UI. He sees a small pencil icon next to a field name in one of the columns of data. What does this pencil icon signify?
column2: Steven can edit the field for various records right from within the search results themselves

column1: What is the primary purpose of Archer Evolv?
column2: To provide an end-to-end risk management and compliance framework

column1: In the new SaaS UI, what does the Attention feature in the right panel do?
column2: It draws the user's attention to fields that are empty

column1: Archer’s primary purpose is:
column2: To support risk management and compliance activities

column1: Archer Solution Areas contain groups of related:
column2: Use Cases

column1: Clicking on the area representing results within a chart will open:
column2: A list of records associated with that chart statistic

column1: If a user clicks on a linked record ID, the link will take the user to:
column2: The record itself
